title: Mike Tindall shares loved-up selfie with Zara sightseeing during trip to Japan
text:
Mike and Zara Tindall appear to be making the most of their time in Tokyo, with the former rugby player sharing a loved-up sightseeing selfie with his wife on Instagram yesterday.

In the holiday snap, Mike, 40, can be seen with his arm around Zara, 38, as they posed for a snap while visiting the Shibuya crossing, a popular tourist spot in the city.

The couple, who have been married for eight years, are currently enjoying a trip to Japan for the Rugby World Cup.

They're set to be joined by Zara's cousin Prince Harry, 35, to watch England take on South Africa in the final on Saturday.

Mike Tindall, 40, shared an affectionate selfie on his Instagram stories as he and his wife Zara, 38, took to the Tokyo streets to take in the sights ahead of the World Cup final on Saturday

Mike and Zara, who wed in July 2011, live with their two children Mia, and Lena, at Gatcombe Park, the Gloucester estate where Princess Anne also lives.

Former rugby player Mike is believed to have flown out for the World Cup in Japan two weeks ago, with Zara joining him ahead of the final on Saturday.

The match will see England take on South Africa, following a dramatic semi-final days ago in which the team triumphed 19-7 against the New Zealand All Blacks.

And Mike and Zara appear to be making the most of their trip to Japan, with the royals taking in some of Tokyo's most popular tourist spots during their visit.

The royal went on to share another snap of the trip as he enjoyed dinner out with wife Zara and friends last night, including his brother-in-law Peter Phillips (right)

Mike, who created his Instagram at the beginning of the month, shared a series of selfies with wife Zara on the Stories of his social media account.

In one of the pictures, Mike can be seen with his arm around Zara while the two visited the popular sightseeing spot the Shibuya crossing in Tokyo.

The couple, who have been married for eight years, smiled broadly at the camera while other tourists crossed in the background.

Mike has shared a series of selfies from his trip to Japan on his Instagram page, including one as he watched England play in the semi-final

The rugby player has kept his 14,000 followers up to date with his trip to Japan, and often shared snaps as he enjoyed matches

In another selfie posted on Mike's Instagram stories, the royals can be seen enjoying dinner out with a group of friends.

The former rugby player has been keeping his 14,000 followers up to date throughout the trip to Japan, with regular selfies taken during the World Cup matches.

Mike and Zara are set to be joined by close friend and fellow member of the royal family Prince Harry for the Rugby World Cup final this weekend.

It was announced yesterday the Duke of Sussex will fly to Japan to watch England play South Africa.

Harry and Mike became firm friends after meeting at the Rugby World Cup in 2003, with the rugby player going on to marry Zara in 2011 (pictured together in 2014)

He is the patron of the Rugby Football Union and has regularly attended England games in the past.

He was seen celebrating with coach Sir Clive Woodward after England's last World Cup win in 2003, and will be hoping the side can repeat the feat in Yokohama on Saturday.

Harry and Mike became firm friends after meeting at the event in 2003, with the sportsman marrying Harry's cousin Zara Phillips eight years later.
description: Mike Tindall, 40, shared the affectionate holiday snap with wife Zara, 38, on his Instagram stories. The couple can be seen beaming as they posed for the selfie while taking in the sights of Tokyo.
